file_content.text: You've won.
No more opposition... Serevin will be pleased.
The tablets... spare them. Please. Without me... they can't hurt you.
If they're found and delivered to the Voss, it could cost me my life.
Someone could find them.
How does sparing the tablets benefit me?
Why would I do that?
You must be joking.
Take them with you. The Sith... want to know what happened here. Find the source... of the power... in the Nightmare lands.
The answers... may be here....
And I would rather... the truth collect dust... in a Sith archive... than be destroyed.
Darth Serevin may find some use for them.
Fine, I'll take the tablets.
Then they will... endure. Good enough.
I won't risk these finding their way to the Voss.
No. [Destroy the tablets]
No! All that knowledge... lost....
Go... return to you master. Tell him... what you've done.
You've interfered enough in the Empire's plans, Jedi. This ends now.
You should have brought more Jedi with you, Keln. The Empire's paying really well to see you out of the way.
Are these all the Jedi you brought with you, Master Keln?
So you're Darth Serevin's pawns?
You must be Darth Serevin's puppet.
All the scurrying you've done to cover the Empire's tracks was wasted. The crimes of the Sith are indelible.
In ancient times, the Voss and Jedi joined forces against a common enemy: the Sith.
Voss was only discovered a few years ago.
That's just not possible.
Rediscovered, apparently.
So, you've uncovered more of Voss's history in a few months than the Voss have in centuries?
Are you sure of that?
The Voss avoid these ruins.
Prove it.
The writing on these stone tablets tells the tale. We're still translating it, but enough of the truth has surfaced already.
It's over. Return to Darth Serevin. There's nothing you can do, now.
I didn't come to negotiate. Darth Serevin wants you dead and your evidence to disappear.
You know I can't do that.
Your proof won't be as convincing after I reduce it to rubble.
I can destroy the tablets.
I can still kill you.
Defend the tablets!
